description: Not content with creating a magazine-fed double barrel shotgun, OCG went even further with the triarii: a gas-operated, magazine fed triple barrel shotgun. Fortunately for the wrists and shoulders of its users, it is chambered for the lighter .410 shot and is semi auto only with a fire selector lever for one, two or three simultaneous shots as a more ergonomic alternative to three separate triggers. Felt recoil is very manageable thanks to its built-in accessories. Compatible with 10-round Saiga-410 magaziness.

The Smoothbore Machine Pistol is either a submachinegun chambered for .410 shotgun shells or an automatic shotgun with the portability of a SMG. Features a 3-round burst mode and its magazine well located inside the grip like some SMGs. It follows the "if any demand exists for it, we should do it" principle in product R&D OmniCorp is known for to the letter. Firing 000 shot in full auto with this gun gives a new meaning to "spray and pray".

"Integrally suppressed shotgun? Are you nuts?" is supposedly how this project was first received, but eventually this shotgun with a vague resemblance to a suppressed Micro-Uzi was approved, developed and went into production, marketed for special forces as a quieter door breaching solution than normal shotguns. While the "big bucket" of an integrated suppressor may be a first, being fed by a non-detachable magazine inside its hollowed grip is also very unusual for a shotgun.
